name: RandomAccessFile
comment: dart-io.RandomAccessFile provides random access to the data in a file. dart-io.RandomAccessFile objects are obtained by calling the open method on a dart-io.File object.

path.name: path
path.comment: Gets the path of the file underlying this RandomAccessFile.

close.name: close
close.comment: Closes the file. Returns a Future<RandomAccessFile> that completes with this RandomAccessFile when it has been closed.

closeSync.name: closeSync
closeSync.comment:
Synchronously closes the file.

Throws a dart-io.FileSystemException if the operation fails.

readByte.name: readByte
readByte.comment: Reads a byte from the file. Returns a Future<int> that completes with the byte, or with -1 if end-of-file has been reached.

readByteSync.name: readByteSync
readByteSync.comment:
Synchronously reads a single byte from the file. If end-of-file has been reached -1 is returned.

Throws a dart-io.FileSystemException if the operation fails.

read.name: read
read.comment: Reads dart-io.RandomAccessFile.read.bytes bytes from a file and returns the result as a list of bytes.

readSync.name: readSync
readSync.comment:
Synchronously reads a maximum of dart-io.RandomAccessFile.readSync.bytes bytes from a file and returns the result in a list of bytes.

Throws a dart-io.FileSystemException if the operation fails.

readInto.name: readInto
readInto.comment:
Reads into an existing List<int> from the file. If dart-io.RandomAccessFile.readInto.start is present, the bytes will be filled into dart-io.RandomAccessFile.readInto.buffer from at index dart-io.RandomAccessFile.readInto.start, otherwise index 0. If dart-io.RandomAccessFile.readInto.end is present, the dart-io.RandomAccessFile.readInto.end - dart-io.RandomAccessFile.readInto.start bytes will be read into dart-io.RandomAccessFile.readInto.buffer, otherwise up to buffer.length. If dart-io.RandomAccessFile.readInto.end == dart-io.RandomAccessFile.readInto.start nothing happends.

Returns a Future<int> that completes with the number of bytes read.

readIntoSync.name: readIntoSync
readIntoSync.comment:
Synchronously reads into an existing List<int> from the file. If dart-io.RandomAccessFile.readIntoSync.start is present, the bytes will be filled into dart-io.RandomAccessFile.readIntoSync.buffer from at index dart-io.RandomAccessFile.readIntoSync.start, otherwise index 0. If dart-io.RandomAccessFile.readIntoSync.end is present, the dart-io.RandomAccessFile.readIntoSync.end - dart-io.RandomAccessFile.readIntoSync.start bytes will be read into dart-io.RandomAccessFile.readIntoSync.buffer, otherwise up to buffer.length. If dart-io.RandomAccessFile.readIntoSync.end == dart-io.RandomAccessFile.readIntoSync.start nothing happends.

Throws a dart-io.FileSystemException if the operation fails.

writeByte.name: writeByte
writeByte.comment: Writes a single byte to the file. Returns a Future<RandomAccessFile> that completes with this RandomAccessFile when the write completes.

writeByteSync.name: writeByteSync
writeByteSync.comment:
Synchronously writes a single byte to the file. Returns the number of bytes successfully written.

Throws a dart-io.FileSystemException if the operation fails.

writeFrom.name: writeFrom
writeFrom.comment:
Writes from a dart-core<dart-core> to the file. It will read the buffer from index dart-io.RandomAccessFile.writeFrom.start to index dart-io.RandomAccessFile.writeFrom.end. If dart-io.RandomAccessFile.writeFrom.start is omitted, it'll start from index 0. If dart-io.RandomAccessFile.writeFrom.end is omitted, it will write to end of dart-io.RandomAccessFile.writeFrom.buffer.

Returns a Future<RandomAccessFile> that completes with this dart-io.RandomAccessFile when the write completes.

writeFromSync.name: writeFromSync
writeFromSync.comment:
Synchronously writes from a dart-core<dart-core> to the file. It will read the buffer from index dart-io.RandomAccessFile.writeFromSync.start to index dart-io.RandomAccessFile.writeFromSync.end. If dart-io.RandomAccessFile.writeFromSync.start is omitted, it'll start from index 0. If dart-io.RandomAccessFile.writeFromSync.end is omitted, it will write to the end of dart-io.RandomAccessFile.writeFromSync.buffer.

Throws a dart-io.FileSystemException if the operation fails.

writeString.name: writeString
writeString.comment: Writes a string to the file using the given dart-convert.Encoding. Returns a Future<RandomAccessFile> that completes with this RandomAccessFile when the write completes.

writeStringSync.name: writeStringSync
writeStringSync.comment:
Synchronously writes a single string to the file using the given dart-convert.Encoding.

Throws a dart-io.FileSystemException if the operation fails.

position.name: position
position.comment: Gets the current byte position in the file. Returns a Future<int> that completes with the position.

positionSync.name: positionSync
positionSync.comment:
Synchronously gets the current byte position in the file.

Throws a dart-io.FileSystemException if the operation fails.

setPosition.name: setPosition
setPosition.comment: Sets the byte position in the file. Returns a Future<RandomAccessFile> that completes with this RandomAccessFile when the position has been set.

setPositionSync.name: setPositionSync
setPositionSync.comment:
Synchronously sets the byte position in the file.

Throws a dart-io.FileSystemException if the operation fails.

truncate.name: truncate
truncate.comment: Truncates (or extends) the file to dart-io.RandomAccessFile.truncate.length bytes. Returns a Future<RandomAccessFile> that completes with this RandomAccessFile when the truncation has been performed.

truncateSync.name: truncateSync
truncateSync.comment:
Synchronously truncates (or extends) the file to dart-io.RandomAccessFile.truncateSync.length bytes.

Throws a dart-io.FileSystemException if the operation fails.

length.name: length
length.comment: Gets the length of the file. Returns a Future<int> that completes with the length in bytes.

lengthSync.name: lengthSync
lengthSync.comment:
Synchronously gets the length of the file.

Throws a dart-io.FileSystemException if the operation fails.

flush.name: flush
flush.comment: Flushes the contents of the file to disk. Returns a Future<RandomAccessFile> that completes with this RandomAccessFile when the flush operation completes.

flushSync.name: flushSync
flushSync.comment:
Synchronously flushes the contents of the file to disk.

Throws a dart-io.FileSystemException if the operation fails.

toString.name: toString
toString.comment: Returns a human-readable string for this RandomAccessFile instance.

hashCode.name: hashCode
hashCode.comment:
Get a hash code for this object.

All objects have hash codes. Hash codes are guaranteed to be the same for objects that are equal when compared using the equality operator ==. Other than that there are no guarantees about the hash codes. They will not be consistent between runs and there are no distribution guarantees.

If a subclass overrides dart-io.RandomAccessFile.hashCode it should override the equality operator as well to maintain consistency.

runtimeType.name: runtimeType
runtimeType.comment: A representation of the runtime type of the object.

==.comment:
The equality operator.

The default behavior for all dart-core.Objects is to return true if and only if this and dart-io.RandomAccessFile.==.other are the same object.

Override this method to specify a different equality relation on a class. The overriding method must still be an equivalence relation. That is, it must be:

  • Total: It must return a boolean for all arguments. It should never throw or return null.

  • Reflexive: For all objects o, o == o must be true.

  • Symmetric: For all objects o1 and o2, o1 == o2 and o2 == o1 must either both be true, or both be false.

  • Transitive: For all objects o1, o2, and o3, if o1 == o2 and o2 == o3 are true, then o1 == o3 must be true.

The method should also be consistent over time, so equality of two objects should not change over time, or at least only change if one of the objects was modified.

If a subclass overrides the equality operator it should override the dart-io.RandomAccessFile.hashCode method as well to maintain consistency.

toString.name: toString
toString.comment: Returns a string representation of this object.

noSuchMethod.name: noSuchMethod
noSuchMethod.comment:
dart-io.RandomAccessFile.noSuchMethod is invoked when users invoke a non-existent method on an object. The name of the method and the arguments of the invocation are passed to dart-io.RandomAccessFile.noSuchMethod in an dart-core.Invocation. If dart-io.RandomAccessFile.noSuchMethod returns a value, that value becomes the result of the original invocation.

The default behavior of dart-io.RandomAccessFile.noSuchMethod is to throw a dart-core.NoSuchMethodError.
